intro: Galium boreale var. kamtschaticum, commonly known as Kamtschatic mountain bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Eastern Siberia and the Far East. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky slopes. Its botanical features make it an important component of alpine and subarctic ecosystems.
